Package de.funfried.netbeans.plugins.external.formatter.strategies

Class AbstractFormatterRunnable

java.lang.Object
de.funfried.netbeans.plugins.external.formatter.strategies.AbstractFormatterRunnable
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public abstract class AbstractFormatterRunnable
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
Abstract implementation of the formatter Runnable. LineBreakpoints get removed and the following breakpoints are getting reattached:
  • ClassLoadUnloadBreakpoint
  • FieldBreakpoint
  • MethodBreakpoint
Author:
bahlef

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    protected static class  AbstractFormatterRunnable.BreakException
    RuntimeException which is used as a break condition inside a Iterable.forEach(java.util.function.Consumer).

  • Field Details

    • changedElements

      protected final java.util.SortedSet<org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>> changedElements
      SortedSet containing document offset ranges which should be formatted.

    • document

      protected final javax.swing.text.StyledDocument document
      The StyledDocument from which the content should be formatted.

    • endOffset

      protected final int endOffset
      End offset to format. Only used for selections.

    • startOffset

      protected final int startOffset
      Start offset to format. Only used for selections.

  • Constructor Details

    • AbstractFormatterRunnable

      protected AbstractFormatterRunnable​(javax.swing.text.StyledDocument document, int startOffset, int endOffset, java.util.SortedSet<org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>> changedElements)
      Constructor which has to be used by subclasses.
      Parameters:
      document - the StyledDocument from which the content should be formatted
      startOffset - the start offset, will be set to zero if equal to endOffset
      endOffset - the end offset, will be set to the documents length minus one if equal to startOffset
      changedElements - SortedSet containing document offset ranges which should be formatted or null to format the whole document

  • Method Details

    • setFormattedCode

      protected boolean setFormattedCode​(java.lang.String code, java.lang.String formattedContent, boolean preserveBreakpoints)
      Applies the given formattedContent to the document. If preserveBreakpoints is true the ClassLoadUnloadBreakpoint, FieldBreakpoint and MethodBreakpoint will be preserved, but LineBreakpoints will get removed anyway.
      Parameters:
      code - the previous (unformatted) content
      formattedContent - the formatted code
      preserveBreakpoints - true to preserve all ClassLoadUnloadBreakpoints, FieldBreakpoints and MethodBreakpoints (but not LineBreakpoints)
      Returns:
      true if and only if the given formattedContent was set to the document, if due to any circumstances (old code equals formatted code, thrown exceptions, ...) the formattedContent wasn't applied false is returned

    • getAllSourceGroups

      @NotNull protected @NotNull java.util.List<org.netbeans.api.project.SourceGroup> getAllSourceGroups​(org.netbeans.api.project.Project p)
      Returns a List within all SourceGroup objects for the given Project.
      Parameters:
      p - the Project
      Returns:
      A List within all SourceGroup objects for the given Project

      Returns the fully qualified name of the top most type of the given FileObject.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      The fully qualified name of the top most type of the given FileObject

    • getLineBreakpoints

      protected java.util.List<org.netbeans.api.debugger.jpda.LineBreakpoint> getLineBreakpoints​(org.netbeans.api.debugger.Breakpoint[] breakpoints, org.openide.filesystems.FileObject fileOfCurrentClass, int lineStart, int lineEnd)
      Returns a List within LineBreakpoints from the given breakpints array which belong to the given fileOfCurrentClass that are between the given lineStart and lineEnd.
      Parameters:
      breakpoints - mixed array of Breakpoints
      fileOfCurrentClass - the FileObject of the currently formatted Java class
      lineStart - the line number where the formatting starts
      lineEnd - the line number where the formatting ends
      Returns:
      A List within LineBreakpoints from the given breakpints array which belong to the given fileOfCurrentClass that are between the given lineStart and lineEnd

    • getPreserveableBreakpoints

      protected java.util.List<org.netbeans.api.debugger.Breakpoint> getPreserveableBreakpoints​(org.netbeans.api.debugger.Breakpoint[] breakpoints, java.lang.String currentClassName)
      Returns a List within all preservable Breakpoints which belong to the given currentClassName from a given mixed Breakpoints array.
      Parameters:
      breakpoints - the mixed Breakpoints array
      currentClassName - the fully qualified class name of the Java class that is currently formatted
      Returns:
      A List within all preservable Breakpoints which belong to the given currentClassName from a given mixed Breakpoints array

    • isSameTypeOrInnerType

      protected static boolean isSameTypeOrInnerType​(java.lang.String className, java.lang.String fqnOfTopMostType)
      Checks if the given className is the same or inner type of the given fqnOfTopMostType. Returns true if the given className is the same or an inner type of the given fqnOfTopMostType.
      Parameters:
      className - the class name to check
      fqnOfTopMostType - the top most type to check against
      Returns:
      true if the given className is the same or an inner type of the given fqnOfTopMostType

    • getFormattableSections

      protected java.util.SortedSet<org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>> getFormattableSections​(java.lang.String code, org.netbeans.api.editor.guards.GuardedSectionManager guards)
      Returns a SortedSet within ranges as Pairs of Integers which describe the start and end offsets which can be formatted in respect to the given GuardedSectionManager.
      Parameters:
      code - the current unformatted content of the document
      guards - the GuardedSectionManager of the document
      Returns:
      A SortedSet within ranges as Pairs of Integers which describe the start and end offsets which can be formatted in respect to the given GuardedSectionManager

    • avoidGuardedSection

      protected java.util.SortedSet<org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>> avoidGuardedSection​(org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer> section, java.lang.Iterable<org.netbeans.api.editor.guards.GuardedSection> guardedSections)
      Checks if a given section interferes with the given guardedSections and if so splits the given section into multiple sections and returns them as a SortedSet.
      Parameters:
      section - the section that should be checked
      guardedSections - the guarded sections of the document
      Returns:
      A SortedSet containing the splitted sections or just the initial section itself if there was no interference with the given guardedSections
